chapter.title: Handling Document Attributes
chapter.para: The following sections describe how to work with document ttributes. The following actions are supported in the Document attributes view:

sect1.title: Defining a Document Attribute
sect1.para: You can define a new document attribute. You can configure the desired properties in a separate dialog.
Proceed as follows to define a new document attribute.

step.para: Switch to the Document attributes view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: The Create Document Attribute dialog opens.

step.para: In the Create Document Attribute dialog, enter the desired settings for the new document attribute.
In the Create Document Attribute dialog, click OK to create the document attribute with the specified settings.

result.para: The dialog closes and the new document attribute is displayed in the list of configured document attributes.

sect1.title: Displaying Document Attributes
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured document attributes in the workspace of the Document attributes view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured document attribute by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the document attribute.
The process to which the document attribute is mapped.
The name of the configured document attribute.

sect1.title: Displaying Document Attribute Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific document attribute in the details pane. The details pane contains the same scope of information as the overview table.
The following information is currently available in the details pane:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the document attribute.
The process to which the document attribute is mapped.
The name of the configured document attribute.

sect1.title: Modifying a Document Attribute
sect1.para: You can edit the properties of a document attribute directly in the overview table.
Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing document type:

step.para: Switch to the Document attributes view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para:
Enter the desired values and click Save Button
, to save the new values.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Document Attributes
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple document attributes in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected document attributes.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected document attributes.

step.para: Switch to the Document attributes view.
Select at least two document attributes from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected document attributes.
In the Process field, specify the process to which you want to link the selected document attributes.
In the Attribute Name field, specify a new name for the selected document attributes, if required.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected document attributes and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected document attributes are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting Document Attributes
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single document attribute or multiple document attributes. Proceed as follows to delete existing document attributes.

step.para: Switch to the Document attributes view.
Select at least one document attribute from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Document Attributes opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Document Attributes, click OK to delete the selected document attribute (or document attributes).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Document Attributes, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected document attribute(s).

result.para: If the document attribute(s) have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the document attribute(s) could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
